DOC.brief_summary: 20 healthy man, 10 in trial group and 10 in control group (randomly divided) will participate in the experiment on order to evaluate if improvement in physical fitness influences spatial learning in humans.
DOC.brief_title: The Impact of Physical Exercise on Navigation Performance in Soldier
DOC.detailed_description: subjects in both groups will perform 4 sets of VO2max test and spatial orientation test with a month between them (total 3 month). in addition, subjects in trial group will follow a training program throughout the trial (running on treadmill 3 times a week), suited according to their result in the first VO2max test. in each set VO2max test will be perform before spatial orientation test , in order to evaluated the subject`s aerobic fitness. the spatial orientation test is composed of 5 following days in which the subject has 3 attempts to arrive to a destination in xbox one controller using a virtual glasses (Oculus Rift DK2). each attempt duration is 2 min.
DOC.criteria: civilian healthy man, aged 1830 without any neurological or psychiatric disorder not wearing eyeglasses athletes or trained man (for both groups)
